thread.title: Shatter-proof Motorola 'Bounce' smartphone's specs leaked

title: Shatter-proof Motorola 'Bounce' smartphone's specs leaked
text: Motorola 'Bounce,' expected to launch by the year end, reportedly sports shatterproof Quad HD display of 5.43 inch. Rumours also suggest that the smartphone will be dust and water-resistant. RELATED NEW DELHI: Lenovo-owned Motorola is reportedly building a rugged smartphone codenamed 'Bounce.' The smartphone, expected to launch by the year end, reportedly sports shatterproof Quad HD display of 5.43 inch. Rumours also suggest that the smartphone will be dust and water-resistant. According to a tweet from Upleaks, the smartphone is powered by Snapdragon 810 MSM8994 processor and packs 3GB RAM. It will come in two storage variants of 32GB with 64GB. Besides this, the smartphone has 21MP primary camera and 5MP secondary camera and packs a 3760mAh battery. As of now, there is no word on which all regions the phone will be launched. Motorola Bounce: 5.43" QHD, MSM8994, 32or64GB/3GB, 21MP/5MP, 3760mAh, Shatterproof, December. pic.twitter.com/A9kpCIiRfH â€” upleaks (@upleaks) August 31, 2015 Meanwhile, Lenovo's mobile unit is all set to become part of Motorola and both brands will run as a single entity in global markets. Under the new setup, current Motorola president Rick Osterloh will be responsible for the two brands, and will report to Lenovo's top brass. Lenovo acquired Motorola from Google in 2014 for $2.91 billion. http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/followceleb.cms?alias=Motorola,Lenovo,Google,Rick Osterloh Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device.
